Removing paragraph that makes no sense
rv changes by anon user 130.232.85.15 because he is incorrect. I already provided sources on the Talk page.

Ero is a loan word - the english definition has nothing to do with its usage in Japanese. Also, "hentai" never was used to refer to animated porn in the past, either. Please disagree on the talk page.
edited because of redirect at hentai_games
Reverting previous edit by anon user "130.232.31.109." The word "hentai" _is_ used in Japan, just not as often anymore.
Reverting. The "ero" does mean "erotic," which is defined as "Of or concerning sexual love/desire; amatory. Tending to arouse sexual desire." All porn fits that description.
Also, while "ero" is derived from "erotic", the usage does NOT match "erotic", but is much closer in tone to "porn".
No, anime porn is never called "hentai" in Japanese. If you disagree, provide a counterexample.
/* Meaning of the word */ Correcting definition as the "tai" æ  in "hentai" å¤æ  does not mean "desire or wish"
rv. Again, this definition was sourced and has withstood the test of many eyes to date. Please cite sources for any proposed alternate definition (see previous [[Talk:Hentai|talk]])
/* Meaning of the word */ This is not the 'tai' you thought it was
rv. Discussion of usage in Japan comes further down in the article, but this article is primarily about the use outside of Japan (hence the "en" in en.wikipedia.org)
Removing things from "see also" that are already linked.
/* Hentai classification */ Sorted, copy edit, reduction in text. The links can tell thier own stories.

/* Hentai classification */ revert again, it's still more accurate

rv. anon edit made without comment or discussion. No indication why this text is not accurate or appropriate
rv. The linked individuals are Japanese "peeping toms". This has nothing to do with anime-style porn, however.

revert chat in the article page. To anon user: If you wish to discuss the page, please click on "discussion" at the top of the page and edit that page instead. Also, consider creating an account.
Just adding the little warning. Its obvious, but no harm done...
rv. I'm not saying your edit is absolutely wrong, but you are at odds with every source I have available. Please take your case to the talk page, and we'll discuss it.
Reverting anon again (note this anon has already been warned on their IP talk page by an admin). To anon: If you wish to discuss, click on the "discussion" link, do not discuss in the article page.
At this point, I can only call this vandalism and revert it. Every attempt as been made to communicate (see talk page and previous edit summaries).
Note to anon user: I'd rather have a reasonable discussion in the talk page than revert war with you over this.
Paranoid: Please read the history, I've long ago made the case for removing everything but the forums links, and someone just slapped them back in without commment.
Revert. It obviously wasn't spam - links were to very different sites. If you object to excessive links, say so or discuss on Talk.
